question: the duluth model is an intervention program that emphasizes
vanilla_rag_result: The Duluth Model is an intervention program that emphasizes a psycho-educational approach to addressing intimate partner violence (IPV) by focusing on the dynamics of power and control in abusive relationships. It aims to re-educate men who are perpetrators of domestic violence, encouraging them to replace maladaptive attitudes with behaviors that promote equality. The program utilizes tools such as the 'power and control wheel' to conceptualize IPV and guide treatment towards achieving healthier relationship dynamics.
